subSections.title: Readings
subSections.text:
{{ja-readings
|goon=じゅ
|kanon=しゅう
|kanyoon=す
|kun=ことぶき-, ことぶ-く, ことほ-ぐ
|nanori=かず, じ, じゅう, すっ, すみ, とし, としかつ, なが, のぶ, のり, ひさ, ひさし, やす, やすし
}}

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じゅ}}
The [[新字体#Japanese|shinjitai]], or Japanese simplified form, of {{m|zh|壽}}. From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じゅ}} {{m|zh|壽|tr=dzyuw<sup>X</sup>||longevity}}.

subSections.title: Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|寿を上る|じゅ を たてまつる}}: to [[toast]] someone with a [[prayer]] for [[long]] [[life]]

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ことぶき}}
Nominalization of the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|寿く|tr=kotobuku}}, itself an alteration of earlier root form ''kotohoku'', a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=ことぶき|言|tr1=koto|t1=words, speech|祝く|tr2=hoku|t2=to pray for a good outcome|pos2=obsolete in modern Japanese}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The meaning shifted over time from ''to say something in [[prayer]] for a good outcome'' to a more general ''to say something [[favorable]] in hope for or upon a [[felicitous]] or [[auspicious]] [[occasion]]''. From there, the meaning expanded to include ''long life''.

This ''long life'' meaning was apparently already in use when the kanji was first imported and applied to this word.

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ことほぎ}}
Nominalization of the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|寿ぐ|tr=kotohogu}}, itself an alteration of earlier root form ''kotohoku'', a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=ことぶき|言|tr1=koto|t1=words, speech|祝く|tr2=hoku|t2=to pray for a good outcome|pos2=obsolete in modern Japanese}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The ''kotohogi'' reading does not appear to be as common as the ''kotobuki'' reading further above.
